page.title: 01Introduction Part 1
page.content: {Auchterhouse}is a small village on the slopes of the{Sidlaws,}seven miles north of{Dundee.}Our area is mostly farmland and hills with a population of two hundred and fifty-seven. A hundred years ago the hill was covered with trees but these have been cut down and nowadays only a few remain. Near the top is an old{sanatorium,}put there for the people who had TB. It was thought the fresh air and smell of pines would do them good. It later became a convalescent hospital for the people of{Dundee.}It is now being converted into flats. Over the past twenty years many houses have been built on the hill. There are three roads,{Old Whisky Rd., Parkside}and{ {Pipers' Way,}all three names having been taken from history.
